channel.title: youkwhd's blog posts RSS
channel.description: an archive consist of articles from youkwhd's blog

item.title: Choosing the right tools
item.description: Sometimes, the tool that you are going to use is not the best solution for the current project that you're building. It is okay to reproduce other people's projects with your preferenced tools, such as the programming language itself. Here are some examples of choosing the right tools.

item.title: Majoring compsci, yet a self-taught
item.description: On the homepage, i mentioned that i am majoring a computer science, that is true. However, there is a catch on why i decided to take a degree.

item.title: What makes a GNU/Linux rice looks good
item.description: I remembered my first time ricing my Ubuntu using vanilla i3 and eventually switched to i3-gaps that makes things a little bit spicy. but still, my GNU/Linux still feels plain. nothing fancy about it, not even compareable to r/unixporn posts

item.title: Rethink before implementing a feature
item.description: A bad habit i have is that i always rush when developing my projects. I felt like time is ticking faster when i do my works, thus that makes make me uncautious to small things to consider.

item.title: Migrating to Flask, hello again to python
item.description: Migrating to Flask, hello again python.

item.title: My first C library, kind of.
The making of my Flask app
item.description: This was actually my first time attempting to make a web app using Flask as a technology interest. It also implies with the programming language, python. I will demonstrate on how this app was made, what steps i took, also some regrets i made while making this app.

item.title: The future of this blog
item.description: I wanted to change up the technologies that i've used on this blog. Something just doesn't feel as rewarding if i myself didn't build this site from scratch, i might just consider making a new one from scratch and make use of bash scripting or make my own simple static site generator using the holy C that supports markdown.
